revised_title: The Role of the Spleen in the Circulation of Fluids and Digestion
tldr: The author investigates the role of the spleen in the digestive system and circulation of fluids. They discovered that the spleen plays a crucial role in separating and absorbing fluids and partially digested food from the stomach, preventing them from mixing with the chyle. The spleen contains cells that hold a watery fluid, which is released when the spleen is distended, and it is connected to the cardiac portion of the stomach through lymphatic vessels.
